title: Control of Threading Dislocation Formation in La-doped BaSnO3 Films Grown by Hybrid Molecular Beam Epitaxy
content: Threading dislocations are extended defects that can modulate the local properties in the materials of interest by modifying the local atomic structure, composition, strain and electronic structure, and is one of the most common defects observed in perovskite oxide thin films [1]. Segregation of La dopant atoms around threading dislocation cores in BaSnO3, a widely studied stannate oxide for its high room temperature electron mobilities, can induce local insulator to metallic like behavior [2-5]. To access these exciting properties in the actual bulk-scale, defect engineering to control their formation is crucial. In this work, we use SrTiO3 substrates, with nanometer scale modifications created on their surface to control the density of dislocations in La-doped BaSnO3 thin films grown by hybrid molecular beam epitaxy (MBE).
